Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water and light.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can represent plants growing healthily when they have water and light in their drawing, using vibrant colors and detailed illustrations to show strong, green leaves and flowers.
The student can illustrate the appearance of plants that do not receive enough water, showing wilting leaves, drooping stems, and perhaps brown edges to indicate struggling plants.
The student can illustrate the appearance of plants that do not receive enough light by depicting pale or yellowing leaves and elongated stems as symptoms of poor health.
The student can use visual patterns to effectively show the difference in plant health with and without water, using clear contrasts between lush and dry-looking sections.
The student can use visual patterns to effectively show the difference in plant health with and without light, showing shaded areas where plants struggle to thrive.
The student can explain through drawings why water and light are necessary for the growth of plants, possibly including elements like the sun, raindrops, or labels that clarify these concepts.
CANNOT: The student may inconsistently label all parts due to focus on illustration detail (e.g., a healthy plant might be labeled, but a struggling plant isn't, without affecting overall impact).
The student might experiment with showing additional environment effects but could lack clarity in these extra elements (e.g., adding animals or insects without clear relevance to the topic).
